intro: Gnaphalium brassii, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. Gnaphalium brassii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry, well-drained soils. It is also known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
